short_text: This Surah is called Nun as well as Al-Qalam, the words with which it begins.
text:
This Surah is called Nun as well as Al-Qalam, the words with which it begins.

Period of Revelation

This too is one of the earliest surahs to be revealed at Makkah, but its subject matter shows that it was sent down at the time when opposition to the Holy Prophet (upon whom be peace) had grown very harsh and tyrannical.

Theme and Subject Matter

It consists of three themes: Replies to the opponents objections, administration of warning and admonition to them, and exhortation to the Holy Prophet (upon whom be peace) to patience and constancy.

At the outset, the Holy Prophet has been addressed, to the effect: "The disbelievers call you a madman whereas the Book that you are presenting and the sublime conduct that you practice, are by themselves sufficient to refute their false accusations. Soon they will see as to who was mad and who was sane; therefore, do not at all yield to the din of opposition being kicked up against you, for all this is actually meant to cow you and make you resort to a compromise with them."

Then, in order to enlighten the common people the character of a prominent man from among the opponents, whom the people of Makkah fully well recognized, has been presented, without naming him:At that time, the Holy Prophet's pure and sublime conduct was before them, and every discerning eye could also see what sort of character and morals were possessed by the chiefs of Makkah, who were leading the opposition against him.

Then, in vv. 17-33, the parable of the owners of a garden has been presented, who after having been blessed by Allah turned ungrateful to Him, and did not heed the admonition of the best man among them when it was given them. Consequently, they were deprived of the blessing and they realized this, when all they had lay devastated. With this parable the people of Makkah have been warned to the effect:"With the appointment of the Holy Prophet (upon whom be peace) to Prophethood, you, O people of Makkah, too, have been put to a test similar to the one to which the owners of the garden had been put. If you do not listen to him, you too will be afflicted with a punishment in the world, and the punishment of the Hereafter is far greater."

Then, in vv. 34-47 continuously, the disbelievers have been admonished, in which the address sometimes turns to them directly and sometimes they are warned through the Holy Prophet (upon whom be peace). A summary of what has been said in this regard, is this: Well being in the Hereafter inevitably belongs to those who spend their lives in the world in full consciousness of God. It is utterly against reason that the obedient servants should meet in the Hereafter the same fate as the guilty. There is absolutely no basis of the disbelievers misunderstanding that God will treat them in the manner they choose for themselves, whereas they have no guarantee for this. Those who are being called upon to bow before God in the world and they refuse to do so, would be unable to prostrate themselves on the Day of Resurrection even if they wanted to do so, and thus would stand disgraced and condemned. Having denied the Qur'an they cannot escape Divine punishment. The rein they are being
given, has deluded them. They think that since they are not being punished in spite of their denial, they must be on the right path, whereas they are following the path of ruin. They have no reasonable ground for opposing the Messenger, for he is a preacher without any vested interest: he is not asking any reward of them for himself, and they cannot either make the claim that they know with certainty that he is not a true Messenger, nor that what he says is false.

In conclusion, the Holy Prophet (upon whom be peace) has been exhorted to the effect:"Bear with patience the hardships that you may have to face in the way of preaching the Faith till Allah's judgment arrives, and avoid the impatience which caused suffering and affliction to the Prophet Jonah (peace be on him)."
description: The surah that opens with the single discrete Arabic letter Nūn and the oath of the Divine One swearing by the instrument of The Pen, as well as all knowledge that people are able to preserve and communicate thereby. It takes its name from “the pen” (al-qalam) mentioned in verse 1. The surah deals with the accusation that Muhammad was not God’s Messenger but merely mad (verse 2 .). The arrogance of those who assume that, because they have some of the good things in this life, they can reject the Revelation, is rebutted (verse 10 .). Examples are given of those who came to regret their arrogance (verse 17 .). The Prophet is urged to remain steadfast (verse 48 .).

Efendi Nahi.verse 68:1: Nûn. Pasha pendën dhe në atë që shkruajnë ata,
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:2: ti, me dhuntinë e Zotit tënd, nuk je i marrë;
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:3: ti, me të vërtetë, do të jesh përherë i shpërblyer
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:4: dhe, me të vërtetë, ti je me virtyte të mëdha
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:5: dhe, ti do të shohësh, por edhe ata (jobesimtarët) do të shohin,
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:6: kush nga ju është i marrë.
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:7: Zoti yt e di më së miri për atë që e ka devijuar rrugën e tij dhe Ai i di mirë ata që janë në rrugën e drejtë.
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:8: Andaj, mos ju përul ti atyre që përgënjeshtrojnë.
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:9: Ata dëshirojnë që ti të bësh lëshime, e të bëjnë (lëshime) edhe ata,
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:10: dhe mos ju përul ti atyre që betohen (rrejshëm), e që janë të poshtër,
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:11: lajkatarit dhe atë që transmeton fjalët për të keq;
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:12: penguesin e të mirav, e kundërvajtësin e mëkatarin e madh;
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:13: të ashpërit dhe pos kësaj edhe kopil, -
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:14: (mos ju përul ti) për shkak se është i pasur dhe ka shumë djemë,
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:15: i cili kur t’i lexohen ajetet Tona (Kur’ani), thotë: “Këto janë vetëm përralla të (popujve të) lashtë!”
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:16: Na (së shpejti), do t’ia damkosim hundën atij!
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:17: Na, do t’i provojmë ata (jobesimtaët), sikundër që i kemi provuar pronarët e kopshtit, të cilët ishin betuar se në mëngjes do t’i marrin frutet;
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:18: e nuk patën thënë: “Nëse do Zoti!”
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:19: Dhe, e goditi atë (kopshtin) një fatkeqësi nga Zoti yt, derisa ata flinin
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:21: Kurse, në agim, ata, e thirrën njëri-tjetrin:
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:22: “Nxitoni herët në kopshtin tuaj, nëe doni t’i tuboni frutet!”
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:23: Dhe at au nisën duke biseduar qetësisht:
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:24: “Mos të lejojmë që të paraqitet asnjë i vobektë në kopshtin tonë!”
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:25: Dhe, ata u nisën herët, të bindur se do të mund t’i pengojnë ata (të vobektit),
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:26: e kur e panë (kopshtin e shkretëruar), ata thanë: “Na, me të vërtetë, qenkemi të humbur;
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:27: por, jo, jo, - krejt paskemi mbaruar!”
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:28: Njëri më i arsyeshëm, prej tyre tha: “A nuk ju thashë unë se duhet ta kujtoni Perëndinë!”
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:29: “Lavdëruar qoftë Zoti ynë!” – thanë. Na, me të vërtetë, paskemi qentë të padrejtë!”
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:30: Dhe, atëherë filluan ta qortojnë njëri-tjetrin.
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:31: “Sa keq për ne!” thanë ata – ne, me të vërtetë, paskemi qenë të egërsuar;
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:32: Zoti ynë mund të na japë edhe më të mirë se këtë; me të vërtetë, ne mbështetemi te Zoti ynë!”
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:33: I tillë ka qenë dënimi, e dënimi në jetën tjetër është më i madh, nëse e dinë!
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:34: Për ata që i druajnë Perëndisë, te Perëndia do të ketë kopshte të dhuntisë, -
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:35: Vallë, a do t’i barazojmë muslimanët me njerëzit e këqinj?! –
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:36: Cka keni ju, si gjykoni ju?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:37: A keni ju ndonjë libër, në të cilin lexoni
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:38: se do të keni atë që e zgjedhni ju?
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:39: Apo, a ka për ju betime të mëdha, që do të vlejnë deri në Ditën e Kijametit, e që do ta keni atë çka e keni caktuar.
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:40: Pyeti ata – kush është garantues për këtë.
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:41: Ose, a kanë ata bashkëpunëtorë në këtë. E, le t’i sjellin ata bashkëpunëtorët e tyre, nëse flasin të vërtetën.
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:42: (Kujtoju) Ditën e vështirë, kur zbulohen të gjitha dhe ata ftohen (thirrën) që të përulen në tokë (në sexhde), e nuk munden (nuk do të kenë fuqi),
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:43: (ata do të jenë) me sy ulur dhe krejtësisht të poshtëruar, - e, me të vërtetë, kanë qenë të ftuar në përulje (sexhde), derisa qenë gjallë dhe shëndoshë.
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:44: Prandaj, më lë ti Mua, (Unë) do t’i dënoj ata që e mohojnë këtë Thënie (Kur’anin), Ne ata gradualisht do t’i mashtrojmë (për dënim) në mënyrë të panjohur
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:45: dhe u japim atyre afat, se, me të vërtetë, mashtrimi Im është i fortë!
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:46: A po kërkon ti shpërblim nga ata, e ata janë të rënduar nga borxhet?
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:47: E, a ka tek ata dijeni të fshehtë, e ata po i përshkruajnë ato?
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:48: Duro ti për gjykimin e Zotit tënd dhe mos u bën si peshkatari (Junusi), kur iu lut Zotit të vet, e ai (Junusi) ishte i hidhëruar,
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:49: dhe, sikur mos ta arrinte atë mirësi prej Perëndisë, ai do të hudhej në një shkretëtirë e do të ishte i qortuar,
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:50: por, Zoti i tij e ka zgjedhur dhe e ka bërë atë në grupin e njerëzve të mirë.
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:51: Pothuajse, me të vërtetë, jobesimtarët duan të të rrëzojnë me shikim kur dëgjojnë Kur’anin, duke thënë: “Ai, në të vërtetë, është i marrë!”
Efendi Nahi.verse 68:52: E, ai (Kur’ani), është këshillë për tërë botën!

null.verse 68:1: Nun! And olsun qələmə və (mələklərin) yazdıqlarına (yaxud lövhi-məhfuzda yazılanlara) ki,
null.verse 68:2: Sən (ya Rəsulum!) Rəbbinin ne'məti sayəsində divanə deyisən!
null.verse 68:3: Və həqiqətən, səni minnətsiz (tükənmək bilməyən) mükafat gözləyir!
null.verse 68:4: Şübhəsiz ki, sən böyük bir əxlaq üzərindəsən!
null.verse 68:5: (Tezliklə) sən də görəcəksən, onlar da görəcəklər,
null.verse 68:7: Həqiqətən, sənin Rəbbin öz yolundan çıxanları da, doğru yoldan olanları da ən gözəl tanıyandır!
null.verse 68:8: Elə isə (ya Peyğəmbər! Allahın ayələrini) yalan sayanlara itaət etmə!
null.verse 68:9: (Müşriklər) istərdilər ki, sən onlara yumşaqlıq göstərəsən, onlar da sənə yumşaqlıq göstərsinlər! (Sən onların bütləri barəsində pis söz deməyəsən, onlar da sənə əziyyət verməsinlər və ya sən onların bütlərinə tapınasan, onlar da sənin Allahına ibadət etsinlər!)
null.verse 68:10: (Ya Peyğəmbər!) İtaət etmə (yalan yerə) hər and içənə, alçağa;
null.verse 68:11: Qeybət edənə, söz gəzdirənə;
null.verse 68:12: Xeyrə mane olana, (zülm etməkdə) həddi aşana, günaha batana;
null.verse 68:13: Daş ürəkliyə, (anlamaza və eyni zamanda) əsli-nəsəbi bilinməyən haramzadaya -
null.verse 68:14: O, mal-dövlət, oğul-uşaq sahibi olsa belə!
null.verse 68:15: Ayələrimiz ona oxunduğu zaman o: "(Bunlar) qədimlərin əfsanələridir!" - dedi.
null.verse 68:16: Biz (tezliklə) onun burnuna damğa basacağıq!
null.verse 68:17: Biz vaxtilə o bağ sahiblərini imtahana çəkdiyim kimi, bunları da (Məkkə mürşiklərini də) imtahana çəkdik. O vaxt (o bağ sahibləri) səhər açılanda (onun meyvələrini) mütləq dərəcəklərinə and içmişdilər.
null.verse 68:18: Və heç bir istisna yeri də qoymamışdılar (inşallah deməmişdilər).
null.verse 68:19: Onlar yuxuda ikən (ya Peyğəmbər!) sənin Rəbbindən o bağa bir bəla gəldi.
null.verse 68:20: Və o (yanıb) qapqara qaraldı (külə döndü).
null.verse 68:21: Onlar səhər qalxıb bir-birini belə səslədilər:
null.verse 68:22: Əgər (məhsul) yığacaqsınızsa, bağınıza tez gedin!"
null.verse 68:23: Nəhayət, yola düşdülər, (yol boyu) bir-birinə xəlvətcə belə deyirdilər:
null.verse 68:24: "(Elə edin ki) bu gün orada yanınıza heç bir yoxsul soxulmasın!"
null.verse 68:25: Onlar (yoxsulları) bağa buraxmağa qadir olacaqlarını güman edərək erkən getdilər. [Və ya: Onlar gücləri yetdiyi halda (yoxsulları) yardımdan məhrum etməkdən ötrü sübh tezdən yola düzəldilər]
null.verse 68:26: (Bağı) bu vəziyyətdə (yanıb külə dönmüş) gördükdə dedilər: "Yəqin ki, (yolumuzu) azmışıq!
null.verse 68:27: Xeyr, biz (bağımızın bərəkətindən) məhrum olmuşuq!"
null.verse 68:28: Onların ən ağıllısı (və insaflısı) dedi: "Məgər mən sizə (Allahı) həmd-səna ilə təqdis etməli olduğunuzu demədimmi?!"
null.verse 68:29: Onlar: "Rəbbimiz pakdır, müqəddəsdir! Həqiqətən, biz zalım idik!" - dedilər.
null.verse 68:30: Onlar bir-birini danlamağa başladılar.
null.verse 68:31: Və dedilər: "Vay halımıza! Biz azğınlıq (tüğyan) edirdik.
null.verse 68:32: Ola bilsin ki, Rəbbimiz (tövbəmizi qəbul buyurub) onun əvəzinə bizə daha yaxşısını versin. Biz Rəbbimizdən (bizi bağışlamasını, bizə mərhəmət əta etməsini) diləyirik!"
null.verse 68:33: (Dünyadakı) əzab belədir. Şübhəsiz ki, axirət əzabı daha şiddətlidir. Kaş biləydilər!
null.verse 68:34: Həqiqətən, Allahdan qorxub pis əməllərdən çəkinənləri Rəbbi yanında Nəim cənnətləti gözləyir!
null.verse 68:35: Məgər Biz müsəlmanları kafirlərlə eynimi tutacağıq?!
null.verse 68:36: (Ey kafirlər! Siz dünyada yoxsul mö'minlərdən var-dövlətcə üstün olduğunuz kimi, axirətdə də onlardan üstün olacağınızı, yaxud ən azı onlarla eyni olacağınızı iddia edirsiniz). Sizə nə olub, necə mühakimə yürüdürsünüz?
null.verse 68:37: Yoxsa (Allahdan nazil olmuş) bir kitabınız vardır ki, (bunları) orada oxuyursunuz?!
null.verse 68:38: Yaxud orada bəyənib seçdiyiniz hər şeyin sizin olacağı yazılmışdır?!
null.verse 68:39: Və ya hökm edib istədiklərinizin sizin olacağınıza dair Bizdən qiyamət gününədək davam edəcək əhd almısınız?!
null.verse 68:40: (Ya Peyğəmbər!) Onlardan soruş ki, hansı biri buna zamindir?
null.verse 68:41: Yoxsa onların (axirətdə müsəlmanlardan üstün və ya onlarla eyni olacaqları barədəki iddialarını təsdiq edən) şərikləri vardır?! Əgər doğru deyirlərsə, qoy şəriklərini gətirsinlər!
null.verse 68:42: İş çətinləşəcəyi (baldırlar açılacağı,lüt-üryan vəziyyətdə qiyamətə gedəcəkləri, qiyamət bütün dəhşəti ilə görünəcəyi, həqiqət aşkar olacağı) və səcdəyə (namaza) də'vət olunacaqları gün onlar (səcdə etməyə) qadir olmayacaqlar.
null.verse 68:43: Gözləri zəlilcəsinə yerə dikiləcək, özlərini də zillət bürüyəcəkdir. Halbuki onlar (dünyada) sağlam olduqları ikən səcdəyə də'vət olunurdular.
null.verse 68:44: (Ya Peyğəmbər!) Artıq bu kəlamı (Qur'anı) yalan sayanları Mənə tapşır. Biz onları özləri də bilmədən tədriclə əzaba giriftar edərik.
null.verse 68:45: Onlara (daha çox günaha batmaq üçün bir müddət) möhlət verərəm. Həqiqətən Mənim əzabım dözülməz dərəcədə şiddətlidir.
null.verse 68:46: Yoxsa sən (risaləti təbliğ etmək müqabilində) onlardan ücrət (muzd) istəyirsən və onlar ağır borc yükü altında qalıblar?!
null.verse 68:47: Yoxsa qeyb (lövhi-məhfuz) yanlarındadır və onlar (səninlə mübahisə etdikləri məsələləri, qiyamət günü kafirlərin Allah yanında mö'minlərdən üstün olacağını oradan öyrənib) yazırlar?!
null.verse 68:48: (Ya Rəsulum!) Sən öz Rəbbinin hökmünə səbr et və balıq sahibi (Yunis peyğəmbər) kimi olma (risaləti təbliğ etməyi yerə qoyma). O zaman o, (balığın qarnında) qəm-kədər içində boğularaq (Rəbbinə) dua etmişdi.
null.verse 68:49: Əgər Rəbbindən ona bir mərhəmət (ne'mət) yetişməsəydi, o, məzəmmət olunaraq quru yerə (səhraya) atılacaqdı.
null.verse 68:50: Amma (tövbə etdikdən sonra) Rəbbi onu (?z bəndələri içərisində) seçdi və salehlərdən (peyğəmbərlərdən) etdi.
null.verse 68:51: (Ya Peyğəmbər!) Həqiqətən, kafirlər Qur'anı eşitdikləri zaman (sənə olan həsədlərindən və qəzəblərindən dolayı) az qala səni gözləri ilə yeyələr. Onlar (sənin barəndə): "O divanədir!" - deyirlər.
null.verse 68:52: Halbuki bu (Qur'an) aləmlərə (insanlara və cinlərə) ancaq bir öyüd-nəsihətdir! (Onun nazil olduğu kimsə heç vaxt divanə ola bilməz!)

null.verse 68:1: Nun. Tako Mi kalema i onoga što oni pišu,
null.verse 68:2: ti nisi, milošću Gospodara svoga, lud;
null.verse 68:3: ti ćeš, sigurno, nagradu neprekidnu dobiti
null.verse 68:4: jer ti si, zaista, najljepše ćudi
null.verse 68:5: i ti ćeš vidjeti, a i oni će vidjeti,
null.verse 68:7: Gospodar tvoj dobro zna onoga koji je s puta Njegova skrenuo i on dobro zna one koji su na Pravome putu,
null.verse 68:8: zato ne slušaj one koji neće da vjeruju,
null.verse 68:9: oni bi jedva dočekali da ti popustiš, pa bi i oni popustili,
null.verse 68:10: i ne slušaj nijednog krivokletnika, prezrena,
null.verse 68:11: klevetnika, onoga koji tuđe riječi prenosi,
null.verse 68:12: škrca, nasilnika, velikog grješnika,
null.verse 68:13: surova i, osim toga, u tuđe pleme uljeza,
null.verse 68:14: samo zato što je bogat i što ima mnogo sinova,
null.verse 68:15: koji govori, kad mu se ajeti Naši kazuju: "To su samo naroda drevnih priče!"
null.verse 68:16: Na nos ćemo Mi njemu biljeg utisnuti!
null.verse 68:17: Mi smo ih na kušnju stavili, kao što smo vlasnike jedne bašče na kušnju stavili kad su se zakleli da će je, sigurno, rano izjutra obrati
null.verse 68:19: I dok su oni spavali, nju od Gospodara tvoga zadesi nesreća
null.verse 68:20: i ona osvanu opustošena.
null.verse 68:21: A u zoru oni su jedni druge dozivali:
null.verse 68:22: Poranite u bašču svoju ako je mislite obrati!
null.verse 68:23: I oni krenuše tiho razgovarajući:
null.verse 68:24: Neka vam danas u nju nikako nijedan siromah ne ulazi!
null.verse 68:25: I oni poraniše uvjereni da će moći to provesti,
null.verse 68:26: a kad je ugledaše, povikaše: "Mi smo zalutali;
null.verse 68:27: ali ne, ne - svega smo lišeni!"
null.verse 68:28: Ponajbolji između njih reče: "Nisam li vam ja govorio da je trebalo na Allaha misliti!"
null.verse 68:29: Hvaljen neka je Gospodar naš! - "mi smo, uistinu, nepravedni bili!"
null.verse 68:30: I onda počeše jedni druge koriti.
null.verse 68:31: Teško nama! - govorili su - "mi smo, zaista, obijesni bili;
null.verse 68:32: Gospodar naš nam može bolju od nje dati, samo od Gospodara našeg mi se nadamo naknadi!"
null.verse 68:33: Eto takva je bila kazna, a na onome je svijetu je, nek znaju, kazna još veća!
null.verse 68:34: Za one koji se budu bojali Allaha biće, zaista, dženneti uživanja u Gospodara njihova -
null.verse 68:35: zar ćemo muslimane sa nevjernicima izjednačiti?!
null.verse 68:36: Šta vam je, kako rasuđujete?
null.verse 68:37: Imate li vi Knjigu, pa u njoj čitate
null.verse 68:38: da ćete imati ono što vi izaberete?
null.verse 68:39: Ili, zar smo vam se zakleli zakletvama koje će do Sudnjeg dana vrijediti da ćete ono što vi odredite imati?
null.verse 68:40: Upitaj ih ko je od njih jamac za to.
null.verse 68:41: Ili, imaju li oni druge jamce? Pa neka jamce svoje dovedu, ako govore istinu.
null.verse 68:42: Na Dan kada bude nepodnošljivo i kada budu pozvani da licem na tle padnu pa ne budu mogli,
null.verse 68:43: oborenih pogleda i sasvim poniženi biće nevjernici - a bili su pozivani da licem na tle padaju dok su živi i zdravi bili.
null.verse 68:44: Zato ostavi Mene i one koji ovaj Govor poriču, Mi ćemo ih postepeno odakle se i ne nadaju patnji približavati
null.verse 68:45: i vremena im davati, jer je obmana Moja, zaista, jaka!
null.verse 68:46: Tražiš li ti od njih nagradu, pa su nametom opterećeni?
null.verse 68:47: Ili je u njih iskonska knjiga, pa prepisuju?
null.verse 68:48: Ti strpljivo čekaj presudu Gospodara svoga i ne budi kao Zunnun koji je u ogorčenju zavapio.
null.verse 68:49: I da ga nije stigla Allahova milost, na pusto mjesto bi izbačen bio
null.verse 68:50: ali, Gospodar njegov ga je odabrao i učinio ga jednim od onih koji su dobri.
null.verse 68:51: Skoro da te nevjernici pogledima svojim obore kad Kur’an slušaju, govoreći: "On je, uistinu, luda!"
null.verse 68:52: A Kur’an je svijetu cijelome opomena!

null.verse 68:1: নূন। শপথ কলমের এবং সেই বিষয়ের যা তারা লিপিবদ্ধ করে,
null.verse 68:2: আপনার পালনকর্তার অনুগ্রহে আপনি উম্মাদ নন।
null.verse 68:3: আপনার জন্যে অবশ্যই রয়েছে অশেষ পুরস্কার।
null.verse 68:4: আপনি অবশ্যই মহান চরিত্রের অধিকারী।
null.verse 68:5: সত্ত্বরই আপনি দেখে নিবেন এবং তারাও দেখে নিবে।
null.verse 68:7: আপনার পালনকর্তা সম্যক জানেন কে তাঁর পথ থেকে বিচ্যুত হয়েছে এবং তিনি জানেন যারা সৎপথ প্রাপ্ত।
null.verse 68:8: অতএব, আপনি মিথ্যারোপকারীদের আনুগত্য করবেন না।
null.verse 68:9: তারা চায় যদি আপনি নমনীয় হন, তবে তারাও নমনীয় হবে।
null.verse 68:10: যে অধিক শপথ করে, যে লাঞ্ছিত, আপনি তার আনুগত্য করবেন না।
null.verse 68:11: যে পশ্চাতে নিন্দা করে একের কথা অপরের নিকট লাগিয়ে ফিরে।
null.verse 68:12: যে ভাল কাজে বাধা দেয়, সে সীমালংঘন করে, সে পাপিষ্ঠ,
null.verse 68:13: কঠোর স্বভাব, তদুপরি কুখ্যাত;
null.verse 68:14: এ কারণে যে, সে ধন-সম্পদ ও সন্তান সন্ততির অধিকারী।
null.verse 68:15: তার কাছে আমার আয়াত পাঠ করা হলে সে বলে; সেকালের উপকথা।
null.verse 68:16: আমি তার নাসিকা দাগিয়ে দিব।
null.verse 68:17: আমি তাদেরকে পরীক্ষা করেছি, যেমন পরীক্ষা করেছি উদ্যানওয়ালাদের, যখন তারা শপথ করেছিল যে, সকালে বাগানের ফল আহরণ করবে,
null.verse 68:19: অতঃপর আপনার পালনকর্তার পক্ষ থেকে বাগানে এক বিপদ এসে পতিত হলো। যখন তারা নিদ্রিত ছিল।
null.verse 68:20: ফলে সকাল পর্যন্ত হয়ে গেল ছিন্নবিচ্ছিন্ন তৃণসম।
null.verse 68:21: সকালে তারা একে অপরকে ডেকে বলল,
null.verse 68:22: তোমরা যদি ফল আহরণ করতে চাও, তবে সকাল সকাল ক্ষেতে চল।
null.verse 68:23: অতঃপর তারা চলল ফিসফিস করে কথা বলতে বলতে,
null.verse 68:24: অদ্য যেন কোন মিসকীন ব্যক্তি তোমাদের কাছে বাগানে প্রবেশ করতে না পারে।
null.verse 68:25: তারা সকালে লাফিয়ে লাফিয়ে সজোরে রওয়ানা হল।
null.verse 68:26: অতঃপর যখন তারা বাগান দেখল, তখন বললঃ আমরা তো পথ ভূলে গেছি।
null.verse 68:27: বরং আমরা তো কপালপোড়া,
null.verse 68:28: তাদের উত্তম ব্যক্তি বললঃ আমি কি তোমাদেরকে বলিনি? এখনও তোমরা আল্লাহ তা’আলার পবিত্রতা বর্ণনা করছো না কেন?
null.verse 68:29: তারা বললঃ আমরা আমাদের পালনকর্তার পবিত্রতা ঘোষণা করছি, নিশ্চিতই আমরা সীমালংঘনকারী ছিলাম।
null.verse 68:30: অতঃপর তারা একে অপরকে ভৎর্সনা করতে লাগল।
null.verse 68:31: তারা বললঃ হায়! দুর্ভোগ আমাদের আমরা ছিলাম সীমাতিক্রমকারী।
null.verse 68:32: সম্ভবতঃ আমাদের পালনকর্তা পরিবর্তে এর চাইতে উত্তম বাগান আমাদেরকে দিবেন। আমরা আমাদের পালনকর্তার কাছে আশাবাদী।
null.verse 68:33: শাস্তি এভাবেই আসে এবং পরকালের শাস্তি আরও গুরুতর; যদি তারা জানত!
null.verse 68:34: মোত্তাকীদের জন্যে তাদের পালনকর্তার কাছে রয়েছে নেয়ামতের জান্নাত।
null.verse 68:35: আমি কি আজ্ঞাবহদেরকে অপরাধীদের ন্যায় গণ্য করব?
null.verse 68:36: তোমাদের কি হল ? তোমরা কেমন সিদ্ধান্ত দিচ্ছ?
null.verse 68:37: তোমাদের কি কোন কিতাব আছে, যা তোমরা পাঠ কর।
null.verse 68:38: তাতে তোমরা যা পছন্দ কর, তাই পাও?
null.verse 68:39: না তোমরা আমার কাছ থেকেকেয়ামত পর্যন্ত বলবৎ কোন শপথ নিয়েছ যে, তোমরা তাই পাবে যা তোমরা সিদ্ধান্ত করবে?
null.verse 68:40: আপনি তাদেরকে জিজ্ঞাসা করুন তাদের কে এ বিষয়ে দায়িত্বশীল?
null.verse 68:41: না তাদের কোন শরীক উপাস্য আছে? থাকলে তাদের শরীক উপাস্যদেরকে উপস্থিত করুক যদি তারা সত্যবাদী হয়।
null.verse 68:42: গোছা পর্যন্ত পা খোলার দিনের কথা স্মরণ কর, সেদিন তাদেরকে সেজদা করতে আহবান জানানো হবে, অতঃপর তারা সক্ষম হবে না।
null.verse 68:43: তাদের দৃষ্টি অবনত থাকবে; তারা লাঞ্ছনাগ্রস্ত হবে, অথচ যখন তারা সুস্থ ও স্বাভাবিক অবস্থায় ছিল, তখন তাদেরকে সেজদা করতে আহবান জানানো হত।
null.verse 68:44: অতএব, যারা এই কালামকে মিথ্যা বলে, তাদেরকে আমার হাতে ছেড়ে দিন, আমি এমন ধীরে ধীরে তাদেরকে জাহান্নামের দিকে নিয়ে যাব যে, তারা জানতে পারবে না।
null.verse 68:45: আমি তাদেরকে সময় দেই। নিশ্চয় আমার কৌশল মজবুত।
null.verse 68:46: আপনি কি তাদের কাছে পারিশ্রমিক চান? ফলে তাদের উপর জরিমানার বোঝা পড়ছে?
null.verse 68:47: না তাদের কাছে গায়বের খবর আছে? অতঃপর তারা তা লিপিবদ্ধ করে।
null.verse 68:48: আপনি আপনার পালনকর্তার আদেশের অপেক্ষায় সবর করুন এবং মাছওয়ালা ইউনুসের মত হবেন না, যখন সে দুঃখাকুল মনে প্রার্থনা করেছিল।
null.verse 68:49: যদি তার পালনকর্তার অনুগ্রহ তাকে সামাল না দিত, তবে সে নিন্দিত অবস্থায় জনশুন্য প্রান্তরে নিক্ষিপ্ত হত।
null.verse 68:50: অতঃপর তার পালনকর্তা তাকে মনোনীত করলেন এবং তাকে সৎকর্মীদের অন্তর্ভুক্ত করে নিলেন।
null.verse 68:51: কাফেররা যখন কোরআন শুনে, তখন তারা তাদের দৃষ্টি দ্বারা যেন আপনাকে আছাড় দিয়ে ফেলে দিবে এবং তারা বলেঃ সে তো একজন পাগল।
null.verse 68:52: অথচ এই কোরআন তো বিশ্বজগতের জন্যে উপদেশ বৈ নয়।

Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:1: Нун. Кълна се в калема и в онова, което пишат!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:2: Ти [о, Мухаммад] - по милостта на твоя Господ - не си луд.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:5: Ти ще видиш и те ще видят
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:7: Най-добре твоят Господ знае кой се е отклонил от Неговия път и най-добре Той знае напътените.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:8: И не се покорявай на отричащите!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:9: Желаят, ако се смекчиш, и те да се смекчат.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:10: И не се покорявай на онзи, който все се кълне и е жалък,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:14: А тъй като има богатство и синове,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:15: когато му бъдат четeни Нашите знамения, казва: Легенди на предците!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:17: Изпитахме ги, както изпитахме и стопаните на градината, когато се заклеха [тайно] да я оберат на сутринта.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:19: И я споходи бедствие от твоя Господ, докато спяха.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:20: И тя стана като черна нощ.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:21: И си викаха един другиму на сутринта:
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:22: Тръгнете към своята реколта в зори, ако ще берете!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:23: И се отправиха, шепнейки един на друг:
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:24: Днес да не влиза там при вас бедняк!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:25: И тръгнаха в зори с твърдо намерение.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:26: И когато я видяха, рекоха: Наистина сме се заблудили.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:28: Най-разумният от тях рече: Не ви ли казах - защо не прославяте Аллах?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:29: Рекоха: Слава на нашия Господ! Бяхме угнетители.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:30: И започнаха взаимно да се укоряват.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:31: Рекоха: О, горко ни, наистина сме престъпващи!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:32: Дано нашият Господ ни даде в замяна по-добра от нея. Ние нашия Господ умоляваме.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:33: Такова е наказанието. А наказанието в отвъдния живот е по-голямо, ако знаят.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:34: Наистина за богобоязливите при техния Господ са Градините на блаженството.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:35: Нима отдадените на Аллах ще сторим да са като престъпниците?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:36: Какво ви е, така да отсъждате?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:37: Или имате книга, от която се учите,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:38: и в нея имате, каквото изберете?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:39: Или имате обещание от Нас до Деня на възкресението да имате онова, което сами отсъждате?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:40: Питай ги кой от тях е поръчител за това?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:41: Или имат съдружници? Да доведат своите съдружници - ако говорят истината -
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:42: в Деня, когато ще се разкрият делата и [тези] ще бъдат приканени да се поклонят, а не ще могат.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:43: Свели поглед, ще ги покрие унижение, а бяха приканвани да се покланят, когато бяха здрави.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:44: Остави на Мен [о, Мухаммад] взимащите за лъжа тази Вест! Постепенно ще ги въвлечем [в погибел], без да разберат.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:45: Ще им дам отсрочка. Моята промисъл е силна.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:46: Или търсиш от тях отплата, та са обременени с дълг?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:47: Или при тях е неведомото и те го записват?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:48: Изтърпи до присъдата на твоя Господ и не бъди като човека в кита, който зовеше, изпълнен със скръб!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:49: Ако не бе го достигнала милост от неговия Господ, щеше да е изхвърлен на голия бряг с упрек.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:50: Но неговият Господ го пречисти и го стори праведник.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:51: И едва не те сразяват с погледи неверниците, когато слушат Напомнянето6, и казват: Той е луд.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 68:52: А то не е друго освен напомняне за световете.

null.verse 68:1: 努奈。以筆和他們所寫的盟誓，
null.verse 68:2: 你為主的恩典，你絕不是一個瘋人，
null.verse 68:3: 你必得享受不斷的報酬。
null.verse 68:4: 你確是具備一種偉大的性格的。
null.verse 68:5: 你將看見，他們也將看見，
null.verse 68:6: 你們究竟誰是害瘋病的。
null.verse 68:7: 你的主的確知道誰是叛離他的正道的，他的確知道誰是遵循他的正道的。
null.verse 68:8: 你不要順從否認真理的人們，
null.verse 68:9: 他們希望你柔順，他們也柔順。
null.verse 68:10: 你不要順從每個妄誓的、卑賤的、
null.verse 68:11: 說謊的、進饞的、
null.verse 68:12: 吝嗇的、過份的、犯罪的、
null.verse 68:13: 粗鄙而且是私生子的人。
null.verse 68:14: 那是因為他是有財產和子嗣的。
null.verse 68:15: 有人對他宣讀我的跡象時，他就說：「這是古人的故事。」
null.verse 68:16: 我將在他的鼻子上打上烙印。
null.verse 68:17: 我確已考驗他們，猶如考驗園圃的主人們一樣。當時，他們曾盟誓，他們必定在早晨收獲園圃中的果實，
null.verse 68:19: 當他們正在睡覺的時候，從你的主發出的災難降臨那個園圃，
null.verse 68:20: 一旦之間變成焦土一樣。
null.verse 68:21: 他們曾在早晨彼此相呼：
null.verse 68:22: 「你們當在早晨到園裡去，如果你們要想收獲。」
null.verse 68:23: 他們走了，途中悄悄地商議說：
null.verse 68:24: 「今天絕不要讓一個貧民走進園圃。」
null.verse 68:25: 他們早晨起來以為自己是能遏制的。
null.verse 68:26: 當他們看見園圃的時候，他們說：「我們碓是迷誤的，
null.verse 68:27: 不然，我們是被剝奪的！」
null.verse 68:28: 他們中最優秀的人說：「難道我沒有對你們說嗎？你們怎麼不讚頌真主呢？」
null.verse 68:29: 他們說：「讚頌我們的主超絕萬物！我們確是不義的。」
null.verse 68:30: 於是他們大家走向前來，互相責備起來。
null.verse 68:31: 他們說：「傷哉我們！我們原來確是放蕩者。
null.verse 68:32: 或許我們的主，以一個比這還好的園圃，補償我們，我們確是懇求我們的主的。」
null.verse 68:33: 刑罰就是那樣的。後世的刑罰確是更重大的，假如他們知道。
null.verse 68:34: 敬畏的人們，在他們的主那裡，必將享受恩澤的樂園。
null.verse 68:35: 難道我使歸順的人像犯罪的人一樣嗎？
null.verse 68:36: 你們有甚麼理由？你們怎麼這樣的判斷呢！
null.verse 68:37: 難道有一本可供你們誦習的天經，
null.verse 68:38: 在那本天經裡你們確有自己所選擇的。
null.verse 68:39: 難道我曾與你們締結過復活日才滿期的、堅定的盟約，因而你們確有你們所判斷的？
null.verse 68:40: 你問他們，他們中有誰能保証那件事呢？
null.verse 68:41: 難道他們有許多配主嗎？教他們把那些配主召喚來，如果他們是誠實的人。
null.verse 68:42: 在那日，大難將臨頭，他們將被召去叩頭，而他們不能叩頭。
null.verse 68:43: 同時，他們身遭凌辱，不敢仰視。而過去他們健全的時候，曾被召去叩頭。
null.verse 68:44: 你讓我懲治否認這訓辭的人吧！我將使他們不知不覺地漸趨於毀滅。
null.verse 68:45: 我優容他們，我的計策確是周密的。
null.verse 68:46: 你向他們索取報酬，教他們擔負太重呢？
null.verse 68:47: 還是他們能知幽玄，故加以記錄呢？
null.verse 68:48: 故你應當忍受你的主的判決，不要像那個葬身魚腹的人一樣。當時，他拗著怒呼籲他的主；
null.verse 68:49: 假若從他的主發出的恩典沒有達到他，那末，他必受責備地被拋到荒涼的地方。
null.verse 68:50: 嗣後，他的主揀選了他，並使他入於善人之列。
null.verse 68:51: 不信道的人們幾乎以他們的怒目使你跌倒。當他們聽到宣讀教誨的時候，他們說：「他確是一個瘋子。」
null.verse 68:52: 這《古蘭經》不是別的，它是對全世界的教誨。

null.verse 68:1: Nún. Při peru a při tom, co píší,
null.verse 68:2: díky milosti Pána svého ty blázen žádný nejsi!
null.verse 68:3: A věru tě očekává odměna neupomínaná,
null.verse 68:4: vždyť vskutku povaha tvá je vznešená.
null.verse 68:5: A spatříš ty a také oni spatří,
null.verse 68:6: kdo z vás je pokušením svedený.
null.verse 68:7: Pán tvůj nejlépe zná, kdož z cesty jeho zbloudili, a dobře ví i o těch, kdož správně jsou vedeni.
null.verse 68:8: Neposlouchej ty, kdo za lháře tě prohlásili!
null.verse 68:9: Rádi by, abys jim lichotil, a pak i oni by ti lichotili.
null.verse 68:10: Neposlouchej žádného křivopřísežníka hnusného,
null.verse 68:11: klevetníka s pomluvami obcházejícího,
null.verse 68:12: dobrému se na odpor stavějícího, nepřítele hříšného,
null.verse 68:13: násilníka, a k tomu původu pochybného
null.verse 68:14: - i když je majetný a syny obdařen!
null.verse 68:15: Když jsou před ním přednášeny naše verše, volá: "Povídačky starých!"
null.verse 68:16: Však bude námi na rypáku označen!
null.verse 68:17: A podrobujeme je zkoušce podobné té, jíž podrobili jsme majitele zahrady, kteří přísahali, že půjdou do ní zrána úrodu sklidit,
null.verse 68:19: A zatímco spali, jedna z metel Pána tvého ji navštívila,
null.verse 68:20: takže za jitra zahrada jak očesána byla.
null.verse 68:21: A zrána na sebe volali:
null.verse 68:22: Pojďme časně na svá pole, abychom všechno sklidili!
null.verse 68:23: A na cestu se vydali a vzájemně si šeptali:
null.verse 68:24: Jen aby nám sem dnes žádný nuzák nepřišel!
null.verse 68:25: A tak za jitra vyrazili, aby rozhodnutí své vyplnili,
null.verse 68:26: však vidouce zahradu, vykřikli: "Věru jsme v bludu byli!
null.verse 68:27: Ba co víc, vždyť nezbylo nám vůbec nic!"
null.verse 68:28: I pravil nejobezřetnější z nich: "Což neříkal jsem vám, že slávu Boží pronésti jsme měli?"
null.verse 68:29: A zvolali: "Sláva budiž Pánu našemu, vždyť vskutku jsme nespravedliví byli."
null.verse 68:30: A vzájemně si výčitky činili
null.verse 68:31: řkouce: "Běda nám, vpravdě jsme vzpurní byli;
null.verse 68:32: ale snad Pán náš výměnou za ni nám lepší dá, vždyť my věru po Pánu svém touhu máme!"
null.verse 68:33: Takový bývá trest na tomto světě, však trest na onom světě ještě větší bude - kéž by si to uvědomili!
null.verse 68:34: Bohabojní pak u Pána svého v zahradách slastí žíti budou.
null.verse 68:35: Což učiníme ty, kdož do vůle Boží se odevzdali, stejnými jako hříšníky?
null.verse 68:36: Co je vám, že tak soudíte?
null.verse 68:37: Máte snad Písmo, z něhož studujete,
null.verse 68:38: a je v něm pro vás jen to, co si vyberete?
null.verse 68:39: Či jste snad s Námi spojeni přísahami platnými do dne zmrtvýchvstání, že dostanete to, co sami rozhodnete?
null.verse 68:40: Zeptej se jich, kteří z nich jsou toho ručiteli,
null.verse 68:41: či zda mají společníky? Ať tedy přivedou své společníky - pravdu hovoří-li -
null.verse 68:42: v den, kdy lýtka budou obnažena a oni výzvu dostanou, aby na zem padli, a schopni toho nebudou.
null.verse 68:43: A hanba na ně padne a zraky ponížením sklopí: vždyť k padnutí na zem vyzváni byli, když ještě v bezpečí na zemi žili.
null.verse 68:44: Nech mne s těmi, kdož toto vyprávění za lež prohlásili; postupně zkázu k nim přivedu, aniž místo, odkud přišla, tušit budou.
null.verse 68:45: Já značný jim dávám odklad, však jistý je můj úklad!
null.verse 68:46: Či žádáš od nich odměnu a zatímco je dluhy tíží
null.verse 68:47: anebo znají nepoznatelné z něhož si píší?
null.verse 68:48: Trpělivě tedy vyčkávej rozsudek Pána svého a nebuď jako onen s rybou, jenž o pomoc volal, když cítil úzkost tísnivou.
null.verse 68:49: A kdyby ho nebylo dostihlo Pána jeho dobrodiní, na holou zemi býval by byl vyvržen pln zahanbení.
null.verse 68:50: Však Pán jeho si jej vyvolil a jedním z bezúhonných jej učinil.
null.verse 68:51: A nevěřící, když připomenutí slyší, div že pohledy tě neproklínají a hovoří: "On džiny je posedlý věru!"
null.verse 68:52: Však není to než připomenutí lidstvu všemu!

null.verse 68:1: Noen. Bij de pen, en bij hetgeen zij schrijven.
null.verse 68:2: Gij zijt, bij de gratie van uw Heer, geen krankzinnige.
null.verse 68:3: En voorzeker er is een loon voor u dat niet zal ophouden.
null.verse 68:4: En gij staat zeker op hoog zedelijk peil.
null.verse 68:5: En gij zult zien en zij (de ongelovigen) zullen ook zien,
null.verse 68:7: Zeker, uw Heer weet het beste wie van Zijn weg afdwaalt en Hij kent het beste degenen die de leiding volgen.
null.verse 68:8: Dus gehoorzaam de loochenaars niet.
null.verse 68:9: Zij zouden willen dat gij meegaande waart, dan zouden zij ook meegaande kunnen zijn.
null.verse 68:10: En geef geen gehoor aan een verachtelijke eedaflegger,
null.verse 68:11: Lasteraar, achterklapper.
null.verse 68:12: Tegenhouder van het goede, overtreder, zondaar,
null.verse 68:13: Laatdunkend, bovendien een berucht misdadiger,
null.verse 68:14: Omdat hij rijkdommen en kinderen bezit.
null.verse 68:15: Wanneer Onze woorden aan hem worden voorgedragen, zegt hij: "Fabelen der oudeu."
null.verse 68:16: Wij zullen hem op de neus brandmerken.
null.verse 68:17: Voorwaar, Wij zullen hen (de ongelovigen) op de proef stellen zoals Wij de eigenaars van een tuin beproefden toen zij zwoeren dat zij zeker het fruit daarvan in de vroege morgen zouden plukken.
null.verse 68:19: Toen kwam er van uw Heer een bezoeking over hen, terwijl zij sliepen,
null.verse 68:20: Waardoor (de tuin) werd als een gemaaid veld.
null.verse 68:21: Toen riepen zij tot elkander in de morgen,
null.verse 68:22: Zeggende: "Gaat vroeg naar uw veld indien gij het fruit wilt plukken."
null.verse 68:23: En zij gingen fluisterend met elkander op weg.
null.verse 68:24: "Laat heden geen arme bij u binnen komen."
null.verse 68:25: En zij gingen vroeg in de morgen uit, (denkende) dat zij de macht hadden om het te verhinderen.
null.verse 68:26: Maar toen zij de tuin zagen, zeiden zij: "Voorwaar, wij zijn verdwaald!
null.verse 68:27: Neen, wij zijn beroofd."
null.verse 68:28: De beste onder hen sprak: "Zeide ik niet tot u: ’Waarom looft gij (God) niet?’"
null.verse 68:29: Nu riepen zij uit: "Glorie zij U, onze Heer! Voorzeker wij waren onrechtvaardig."
null.verse 68:30: Toen gingen zij elkaar beschuldigen.
null.verse 68:31: En zeiden: "Wee ons, wij waren inderdaad overtreders.
null.verse 68:32: Het kan zijn dat onze Heer ons een betere tuin dan deze zal geven, wij wenden ons tot onze Heer."
null.verse 68:33: Zo is de straf (voor dit leven). En voorwaar, de straf van het Hiernamaals zal nog groter zijn, konden zij dit maar begrijpen!
null.verse 68:34: Inderdaad, voor de rechtvaardigen zijn er verrukkelijke tuinen bij hun Heer!
null.verse 68:35: Zullen Wij dan degenen die zich onderwerpen even als de schuldigen behandelen?
null.verse 68:36: Wat is er met u? Hoe oordeelt gij?
null.verse 68:37: Hebt gij een Boek waarin gij leest?
null.verse 68:38: Dat gij alles waarnaar gij verlangt zult verkrijgen?
null.verse 68:39: Of hebt gij enige verdragen met Ons gesloten tot de Dag der Opstanding zodat gij dan alles zult hebben wat gij zult willen?
null.verse 68:40: Vraag hun, wie van hen daar borg voor is.
null.verse 68:41: Of hebben zij soms deelgenoten? Laten zij dan deze naar voren brengen als zij de waarheid spreken.
null.verse 68:42: Op de Dag, waarop men beangstigd wordt, zullen zij geroepen worden te prostreren, maar zij zullen dat niet kunnen doen.
null.verse 68:43: Hun ogen zullen terneergeslagen zijn en vernedering zal hen overvallen, want zij werden tot het prostraat Sadjdah geroepen toen hun niets ontbrak (en zij deden het niet).
null.verse 68:44: Laat Mij en degenen die deze aankondiging loochenen, alleen. Wij zullen hen stap voor stap (de vernietiging) doen naderen, op een wijze die zij niet kennen.
null.verse 68:45: En Ik geef hun uitstel; want Mijn opzet is sterk.
null.verse 68:46: Vraagt gij van hen een beloning voor u zelf zodat zij onder schuld gebukt gaan?
null.verse 68:47: Of hebben zij kennis van het onzienlijke, zodat zij het kunnen opschrijven?
null.verse 68:48: Wacht geduldig op het gebod van uw Heer en wees niet als de man van de vis toen hij (God) aanriep terwijl hij misnoegd was.
null.verse 68:49: Als een gunst van zijn Heer hem niet had bereikt dan zou hji zeker op een dorre kust geworpen zijn, terwijl hij vernederd werd.
null.verse 68:50: Maar zijn Heer verkoos hem en maakte hem tot één der goeden.
null.verse 68:51: En de ongelovigen wanneer zij het vermaan horen willen u met hun blikken gaarne ten val brengen; en zij zeggen: "Hij is zeker krankzinnig."
null.verse 68:52: Neen, het (Boek) is niets dan een vermaning voor de werelden.

Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:1: Nun. By the pen and that which they write (therewith),
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:2: Thou art not, for thy Lord’s favour unto thee, a madman.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:3: And lo! thine verily will be a reward unfailing.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:4: And lo! thou art of a tremendous nature.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:5: And thou wilt see and they will see
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:6: Which of you is the demented.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:7: Lo! thy Lord is Best Aware of him who strayeth from His way, and He is Best Aware of those who walk aright.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:8: Therefor obey not thou the rejecters
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:9: Who would have had thee compromise, that they may compromise.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:10: Neither obey thou each feeble oath-monger,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:12: Hinderer of the good, transgressor, malefactor
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:14: It is because he is possessed of wealth and children
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:15: That, when Our revelations are recited unto him, he saith: Mere fables of the men of old.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:16: We shall brand him on the nose.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:17: Lo! We have tried them as We tried the owners of the garden when they vowed that they would pluck its fruit next morning,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:18: And made no exception (for the Will of Allah);
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:19: Then a visitation from thy Lord came upon it while they slept
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:20: And in the morning it was as if plucked.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:21: And they cried out one unto another in the morning,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:22: Saying: Run unto your field if ye would pluck (the fruit).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:23: So they went off, saying one unto another in low tones:
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:24: No needy man shall enter it to-day against you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:25: They went betimes, strong in (this) purpose.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:26: But when they saw it, they said: Lo! we are in error!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:28: The best among them said: Said I not unto you: Why glorify ye not (Allah) ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:29: They said: Glorified be our Lord! Lo! we have been wrong-doers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:30: Then some of them drew near unto others, self-reproaching.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:31: They said: Alas for us! In truth we were outrageous.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:32: It may be that our Lord will give us better than this in place thereof. Lo! we beseech our Lord.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:33: Such was the punishment. And verily the punishment of the Hereafter is greater if they did but know.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:34: Lo! for those who keep from evil are gardens of bliss with their Lord.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:35: Shall We then treat those who have surrendered as We treat the guilty ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:36: What aileth you ? How foolishly ye judge!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:37: Or have ye a scripture wherein ye learn
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:38: That ye shall indeed have all that ye choose ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:39: Or have ye a covenant on oath from Us that reacheth to the Day of Judgment, that yours shall be all that ye ordain ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:40: Ask them (O Muhammad) which of them will vouch for that!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:41: Or have they other gods ? Then let them bring their other gods if they are truthful
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:42: On the day when it befalleth in earnest, and they are ordered to prostrate themselves but are not able,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:43: With eyes downcast, abasement stupefying them. And they had been summoned to prostrate themselves while they were yet unhurt.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:44: Leave Me (to deal) with those who give the lie to this pronouncement. We shall lead them on by steps from whence they know not.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:45: Yet I bear with them, for lo! My scheme is firm
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:46: Or dost thou (Muhammad) ask a fee from them so that they are heavily taxed ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:47: Or is the Unseen theirs that they can write (thereof) ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:48: But wait thou for thy Lord’s decree, and be not like him of the fish, who cried out in despair.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:49: Had it not been that favour from his Lord had reached him he surely had been cast into the wilderness while he was reprobate.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:50: But his Lord chose him and placed him among the righteous.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:51: And lo! those who disbelieve would fain disconcert thee with their eyes when they hear the Reminder, and they say: Lo! he is indeed mad;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 68:52: When it is naught else than a Reminder to creation.

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:1: Nun. By the Pen and the (Record) which (men) write,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:2: Thou art not, by the Grace of thy Lord, mad or possessed.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:3: Nay, verily for thee is a Reward unfailing:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:4: And thou (standest) on an exalted standard of character.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:5: Soon wilt thou see, and they will see,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:6: Which of you is afflicted with madness.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:7: Verily it is thy Lord that knoweth best, which (among men) hath strayed from His Path: and He knoweth best those who receive (true) Guidance.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:8: So hearken not to those who deny (the Truth).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:9: Their desire is that thou shouldst be pliant: so would they be pliant.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:10: Heed not the type of despicable men,- ready with oaths,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:11: A slanderer, going about with calumnies,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:12: (Habitually) hindering (all) good, transgressing beyond bounds, deep in sin,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:13: Violent (and cruel),- with all that, base-born,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:14: Because he possesses wealth and (numerous) sons.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:15: When to him are rehearsed Our Signs, "Tales of the ancients", he cries!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:16: Soon shall We brand (the beast) on the snout!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:17: Verily We have tried them as We tried the People of the Garden, when they resolved to gather the fruits of the (garden) in the morning.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:18: But made no reservation, ("If it be God’s Will").
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:19: Then there came on the (garden) a visitation from thy Lord, (which swept away) all around, while they were asleep.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:20: So the (garden) became, by the morning, like a dark and desolate spot, (whose fruit had been gathered).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:21: As the morning broke, they called out, one to another,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:22: "Go ye to your tilth (betimes) in the morning, if ye would gather the fruits."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:23: So they departed, conversing in secret low tones, (saying)-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:24: "Let not a single indigent person break in upon you into the (garden) this day."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:25: And they opened the morning, strong in an (unjust) resolve.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:26: But when they saw the (garden), they said: "We have surely lost our way:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:27: "Indeed we are shut out (of the fruits of our labour)!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:28: Said one of them, more just (than the rest): "Did I not say to you, ’Why not glorify (God)?’"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:29: They said: "Glory to our Lord! Verily we have been doing wrong!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:30: Then they turned, one against another, in reproach.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:31: They said: "Alas for us! We have indeed transgressed!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:32: "It may be that our Lord will give us in exchange a better (garden) than this: for we do turn to Him (in repentance)!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:33: Such is the Punishment (in this life); but greater is the Punishment in the Hereafter,- if only they knew!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:34: Verily, for the Righteous, are Gardens of Delight, in the Presence of their Lord.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:35: Shall We then treat the People of Faith like the People of Sin?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:36: What is the matter with you? How judge ye?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:37: Or have ye a book through which ye learn-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:38: That ye shall have, through it whatever ye choose?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:39: Or have ye Covenants with Us to oath, reaching to the Day of Judgment, (providing) that ye shall have whatever ye shall demand?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:40: Ask thou of them, which of them will stand surety for that!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:41: Or have they some "Partners" (in Godhead)? Then let them produce their "partners", if they are truthful!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:42: The Day that the shin shall be laid bare, and they shall be summoned to bow in adoration, but they shall not be able,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:43: Their eyes will be cast down,- ignominy will cover them; seeing that they had been summoned aforetime to bow in adoration, while they were whole, (and had refused).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:44: Then leave Me alone with such as reject this Message: by degrees shall We punish them from directions they perceive not.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:45: A (long) respite will I grant them: truly powerful is My Plan.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:46: Or is it that thou dost ask them for a reward, so that they are burdened with a load of debt
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:47: Or that the Unseen is in their hands, so that they can write it down?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:48: So wait with patience for the Command of thy Lord, and be not like the Companion of the Fish,- when he cried out in agony.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:49: Had not Grace from his Lord reached him, he would indeed have been cast off on the naked shore, in disgrace.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:50: Thus did his Lord choose him and make him of the Company of the Righteous.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:51: And the Unbelievers would almost trip thee up with their eyes when they hear the Message; and they say: "Surely he is possessed!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 68:52: But it is nothing less than a Message to all the worlds.

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:1: Nun. By the Pen, and what they inscribe,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:2: thou art not, by the blessing of thy Lord, a man possessed.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:3: Surely thou shalt have a wage unfailing;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:4: surely thou art upon a mighty morality.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:5: So thou shalt see, and they will see,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:6: which of you is the demented.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:7: Surely thy Lord knows very well those who have gone astray from His way, and He knows very well those who are guided.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:8: So obey thou not those who cry lies.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:9: They wish that thou shouldst compromise, then they would compromise.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:10: And obey thou not every mean swearer,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:12: hinderer of good, guilty aggressor, coarse-grained,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:14: because he has wealth and sons.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:15: When Our signs are recited to him, he says, ’Fairy-tales of the ancients!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:16: We shall brand him upon the muzzle!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:17: Now We have tried them, even as We tried the owners of the garden when they swore they would pluck in the morning
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:18: and they added not the saving words.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:19: Then a visitation from thy Lord visited it, while they were sleeping,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:20: and in the morning it was as if it were a garden plucked.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:21: In the morning they called to one another,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:22: ’Come forth betimes upon your tillage, if you would pluck!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:24: ’No needy man shall enter it today against your will.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:25: And they went forth early, determined upon their purpose.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:26: But when they saw it, they said, ’Surely we are gone astray;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:27: nay, rather we have been robbed!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:28: Said the most moderate of them, ’Did I not say to you, "Why do you not give glory?"’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:29: They said, ’Glory be to God, our Lord; truly, we were evildoers.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:30: And they advanced one upon another, blaming each other.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:31: They said, ’Woe, alas for us! Truly, we were insolent.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:32: It may be that our Lord will give us in exchange a better than it; to our Lord we humbly turn.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:33: Such is the chastisement; and the chastisement of the world to come, is assuredly greater, did they but know.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:34: Surely for the godfearing shall be Gardens of Bliss with their Lord.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:35: What, shall we make those who have surrendered like to the sinners?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:36: What ails you then, how you judge?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:37: Or have you a Book wherein you study?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:38: Surely therein you shall have whatever you choose!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:39: Or have you oaths from Us, reaching to the Day of Resurrection? Surely you shall have whatever you judge!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:40: Ask them, which of them will guarantee that!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:41: Or do they have associates? Then let them bring their associates, if they speak truly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:42: Upon the day when the leg shall be bared, and they shall be summoned to bow themselves, but they cannot;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:43: humbled shall be their eyes, and abasement shall overspread them, for they had been summoned to bow themselves while they were whole.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:44: So leave Me with him who cries lies to this discourse! We will draw them on little by little whence they know not;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:45: and I shall respite them -- assuredly My guile is sure.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:46: Or askest thou them for a wage, and so they are weighed down with debt?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:47: Or is the Unseen in their keeping, and so they are writing it down?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:48: So be thou patient under the judgment of thy Lord, and be not as the Man of the Fish, when he called, choking inwardly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:49: Had there not overtaken him a blessing from his Lord he would have been cast upon the wilderness, being condemned.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:50: But his Lord had chosen him, and He placed him among the righteous.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:51: The unbelievers wellnigh strike thee down with their glances, when they hear the Reminder, and they say, ’Surely he is a man possessed!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 68:52: And it is nothing but a Reminder unto all beings.

Muhammad Asad.verse 68:1: Nūn. CONSIDER the pen, and all that they write !
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:2: Thou art not, by thy Sustainer’s grace, a madman!
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:3: And, verily, thine shall be a reward never-ending
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:4: for, behold, thou keepest indeed to a sublime way of life;
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:5: and [one day] thou shalt see, and they [who now deride thee] shall see,
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:6: which of you was bereft of reason.
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:7: Verily, thy Sustainer alone is fully aware as to who has strayed from His path, just as He alone is fully aware of those who have found the right way.
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:8: Hence, defer not to [the likes and dislikes of] those who give the lie to the truth:
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:9: they would like thee to be soft [with them], so that they might be soft [with thee].
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:10: Furthermore, defer not to the contemptible swearer of oaths,
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:11: [or to] the slanderer that goes about with defaming tales,
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:12: [or] the withholder of good, [or] the sinful aggressor,
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:13: [or] one who is cruel, by greed possessed, and, in addition to all this, utterly useless [to his fellow-men].
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:14: Is it because he is possessed of worldly goods and children
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:15: that, whenever Our messages are conveyed to him, such a one says, "Fables of ancient times"?
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:16: [For this] We shall brand him with indelible disgrace!
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:17: [As for such sinners,] behold, We [but] try them as We tried the owners of a certain garden who vowed that they would surely harvest its fruit on the morrow,
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:18: and made no allowance [for the will of God]:
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:19: whereupon a visitation from thy Sustainer came upon that [garden] while they were asleep,
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:20: so that by the morrow it became barren and bleak.
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:21: Now when they rose at early morn, they called unto one another,
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:22: "Go early to your tilth if you want to harvest the fruit!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:23: Thus they launched forth, whispering unto one another,
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:24: "Indeed, no needy person shall enter it today [and come] upon you !"
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:25: and early they went, strongly bent upon their purpose.
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:26: But as soon as they beheld [the garden and could not recognize] it, they exclaimed, "Surely we have lost our way!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:27: [and then,] "Nay, but we have been rendered destitute!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:28: Said the most right-minded among them: "Did I not tell you, ‘Will you not extol God’s limitless glory?’"
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:29: They answered: "Limitless in His glory is our Sustainer! Verily, we were doing wrong!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:30: and then they turned upon one another with mutual reproaches.
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:31: [In the end] they said: "Oh, woe unto us! Verily, we did behave outrageously!
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:32: [But] it may be that our Sustainer will grant us something better instead: for, verily, unto our Sustainer do we turn with hope!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:33: SUCH is the suffering [with which We try some people in this world]; but greater by far will be the suffering [which sinners shall have to bear] in the life to come – if they but knew it!
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:34: For, behold, it is the God-conscious [alone] whom gardens of bliss await with their Sustainer:
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:35: or should We, perchance, treat those who surrender themselves unto Us as [We would treat] those who remain lost in sin?
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:36: What is amiss with you? On what do you base your judgment [of right and wrong]?
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:37: Or have you, perchance, a [special] divine writ which you study,
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:38: and in which you find all that you may wish to find?
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:39: Or have you received a solemn promise, binding on Us till Resurrection Day, that yours will assuredly be whatever you judge [to be your rightful due]?
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:40: Ask them which of them is able to vouch for this!
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:41: Or have they, perchance, any sages to support their views? Well, then, if they are sincere in this their claim, let them produce those supporters of theirs
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:42: on the Day when man’s very being shall be bared to the bone, and when they [who now deny the truth] shall be called upon to prostrate themselves [before God], and shall be unable to do so:
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:43: downcast will be their eyes, with ignominy overwhelming them – seeing that they had been called upon [in vain] to prostrate themselves [before Him] while they were yet sound [and alive].
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:44: Hence, leave Me alone with such as give the lie to this tiding. We shall bring them low, step by step, without their perceiving how it has come about:
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:45: for, behold, though I may give them rein for a while, My subtle scheme is exceedingly firm!
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:46: Or is it that [they fear lest] thou ask them for a reward, [O Prophet,] so that they would be burdened with debt [if they listened to thee]?
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:47: Or [do they think] that the hidden reality [of all that exists] is within their grasp, so that [in time] they can write it down?
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:48: BEAR, THEN, with patience thy Sustainer’s will, and be not like him of the great fish, who cried out [in distress] after having given in to anger.
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:49: [And remember:] had not grace from his Sustainer reached him, he would indeed have been cast forth upon that barren shore in a state of disgrace:
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:50: but [as it was,] his Sustainer had elected him and placed him among the righteous.
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:51: Hence, [be patient,] even though they who are bent on denying the truth would all but kill thee with their eyes whenever they hear this reminder, and [though] they say, "[As for Muhammad,] behold, most surely he is a madman!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 68:52: [Be patient:] for this is nought else but reminder [from God] to all mankind.

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:1: Nūn , by the pen and what they write,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:2: with the grace of your Lord, you are not insane.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:3: And you will definitely have a reward that will never end.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:4: And you are surely on an excellent standard of character.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:5: So, you will see, and they will see
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:7: Surely your Lord knows best who has strayed from his way, and He is well aware of those who are on the right path.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:8: So, do not obey those who reject (the true faith.)
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:9: They wish that you become flexible (in your faith), so that they should become flexible (in their hostile attitude.)
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:10: And do not obey any contemptible one who swears much,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:11: a slanderer who goes about with calumnies,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:12: one who prevents good, (and who is) transgressor, sinful,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:14: (do not obey such a person merely) because he is a man of wealth and sons.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:15: When Our verses are recited to him, he says, “(These are) the tales of the ancient.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:16: We will soon brand him on the snout.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:17: We have tested them as We had tested the Owners of the Garden, when they had sworn an oath that they would pluck its fruits on the next morning,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:18: and did not make any exception (by saying inshā’allāh ).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:19: Then, there whirled around it a whirl (of calamity) from your Lord, while they were asleep.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:20: Thus, on the next morning, it was like a harvested field.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:21: So, they called out each other as the morning broke,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:22: saying, “Set out early, if you are going to pluck (the fruits).”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:23: So they set out while they were whispering to each other,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:24: saying, “Let no poor man enter into it upon you today.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:25: And in early hours they rushed quickly, while they were (assuming themselves) powerful (to pluck the fruits and prevent the poor.)
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:26: But when they saw it (the place of the ruined garden), they said, “We have missed the way.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:27: (Then, once they realized that the garden is the same, but it has been destroyed, they said,) “No, but we are deprived (of the fruits).”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:28: Said he who was the best among them, “Did I not say to you, ‘Why do you not pronounce tasbīH (Allah’s purity)?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:29: They said, “We pronounce the purity of our Lord. No doubt, we were wrongdoers.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:30: Then, (at the beginning,) they started reproaching one another;
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:31: (and at last,) they said, “Woe to us! In fact, we (all) were outrageous.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:32: We hope that our Lord will give us in exchange something better than this. Truly we turn to Allah.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:33: In this way the punishment comes. And, of course, the punishment of the Hereafter is even greater, if they but realize!
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:34: Surely, for the God-fearing there are gardens of bliss.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:35: Otherwise, shall We make the obedient like the sinners?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:36: What has happened to you? How do you judge?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:37: Do you have a book in which you read
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:38: that for you there is what you choose?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:39: Or do you have oaths sworn by Us, remaining effective up to the Day of Judgment, that you will get what you decide?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:40: Ask them which of them stands surety for that.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:41: Or do they have associate-gods (who have guaranteed safety for them)? Then, let them bring their associate-gods, if they are true.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:42: On the Day when the Shin will be exposed, and they will be called upon to prostrate themselves, they will not be able to.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:43: With their eyes downcast, they will be enveloped by ignominy. They used to be called upon to prostrate when they were healthy (but they did not.)
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:44: So, leave Me alone with those who reject this discourse. We will draw them on little by little (towards Hell) from a way they do not know.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:45: And I give them respite. Indeed, My plan is firm.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:46: Is it that you ask them for a fee, due to which they are burdened with debt?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:47: Or do they have the (knowledge of the) Unseen, and they write it down?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:48: So, remain patient with your Lord’s judgment, and be not like the Man of the Fish, he cried out while he was in anguish.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:49: Had not a favour from His Lord come to his help, he would have been cast in the wilderness in a reproachable state.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:50: Then his Lord chose him, and made him one of the righteous.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:51: And indeed the disbelievers seem to trip you up with their glances when they hear the Reminder, and say, “He is a madman indeed.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 68:52: And it is nothing else but a Reminder for all the worlds.

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:1: Nūn. By the Pen and what they inscribe.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:2: You are not by the grace of your Lord, a madman.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:3: And assuredly you will have an unfailing reward.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:4: And assuredly you possess a magnificent nature.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:5: Then you will see and they will see,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:7: Assuredly your Lord knows best those who stray from His way, and He knows best those who are guided.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:8: So do not obey the deniers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:9: They desire that you should be pliable, so that they may be pliable [towards you].
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:10: And do not obey any mean oath-monger,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:14: [only] because he has wealth and sons.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:15: When Our signs are recited to him, he says: ‘Fables of the ancients!’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:16: We shall brand him on the snout.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:17: Indeed We have tried them, just as We tried the owners of the garden, when they vowed that they would pluck in the morning.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:18: And they did not make any exception.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:19: Then a visitation from your Lord visited it while they slept.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:20: So by the morning it was like the darkness of night.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:21: They then called out to one another in the morning,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:22: [saying], ‘Go forth early to your tillage if you are going to pluck’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:23: So off they went, whispering to one another:
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:24: ‘No needy person shall today come to you in it’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:25: And they went forth early, able to prohibit.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:26: But when they saw it, they said, ‘Assuredly we have strayed!’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:28: The most moderate among them said, ‘Did I not say to you, “Why do you not glorify?” ’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:29: They said, ‘Glory be to God, our Lord. Verily we have been wrongdoers’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:30: They then turned to one another, blaming each other.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:31: They said, ‘O woe to us! We have indeed been unjust.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:32: It may be that our Lord will give us in its place one that is better than it. Truly we turn humbly to our Lord’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:33: Such will be the chastisement; and the chastisement of the Hereafter is assuredly greater, did they but know.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:34: Verily for the God-fearing there will be the Gardens of Bliss near their Lord.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:35: Are We then to treat those who submit [to Us] as [We treat] the sinners?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:36: What is wrong with you? How do you judge?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:37: Or do you have a Scripture, wherein you learn,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:38: that you will indeed have in it whatever you choose?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:39: Or do you have oaths, binding on Us until the Day of Resurrection that you will indeed have whatever you decide?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:40: Ask them, which of them will aver that?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:41: Or do they have partners? Then let them produce their partners if they are truthful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:42: The day when the shank is bared and they are summoned to prostrate themselves, but they will not be able [to do so].
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:43: With humbled gazes they will be overcast by abasement; for they had indeed been summoned to prostrate themselves while they were yet sound.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:44: So leave Me [to deal] with those who deny this discourse. We will draw them on by degrees, whence they do not know.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:45: And I will grant them respite; [for] assuredly My devising is firm.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:46: Or are you asking them a fee, so that they are weighed down with debt?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:47: Or do they possess [access to] the Unseen, so that they are writing down?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:48: So await patiently the judgement of your Lord, and do not be like the one of the whale, who called out, choking with grief.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:49: Had it not been for a grace from his Lord that reached him, he would have surely been cast onto a wilderness, while he was blameworthy.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:50: But his Lord chose him and made him one of the righteous.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:51: Indeed those who disbelieve would almost throw you down [to the ground] with their looks when they hear the Reminder, and they say: ‘He is truly a madman!’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 68:52: Yet it is just a Reminder for all the worlds.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:1: Nun. (Only Allah and the Messenger [blessings and peace be upon him] know the real meaning.) By the pen and by that (subject) which (the angels) write down!
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:2: (O Esteemed Beloved!) By the Grace of your Lord, you are not (at all) insane.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:3: And assuredly, for you there is a reward that will never end.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:4: And assuredly, you are placed high on the Most Glorious and Exalted (seat of) character (i.e., adorned with the Qur’anic morality and endowed with the character traits of Allah).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:5: Soon you will see and they (too) will see,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:6: As to which of you is mad.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:7: Surely, your Lord knows him best who has strayed from the straight path and (also) knows best those who are rightly guided.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:8: So do not agree with what the beliers say.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:9: They wish that you should become (needlessly) flexible (in the matter of the Din [Religion]). Then they too would show flexibility.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:10: And do not agree with any vile, most mean swearer of oaths,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:11: (The one who is) a slanderer, fault-finder, mischief-monger, (and) who backbites the people to rouse strife,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:12: (The one who) greatly hinders pious works and is a miser, rebellious transgressor (and) toughened sinner,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:13: (The one who is) rude, unmannerly, crooked and moreover of doubtful birth.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:14: So (do not pay any heed to him) because he is wealthy and has children.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:15: When Our Verses are recited to him, he says: ‘These are the fictitious stories of the bygone people.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:16: Now We shall brand him on the snout.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:17: Surely, We will try them (the inhabitants of Mecca in the same way) as We tried (in Yemen) the owners of the garden when they swore that they would surely pluck its fruit the next morning.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:18: And they did not make any exception (saying ‘if Allah wills’ or for the share of the orphans).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:19: So a whirl (of disaster) from your Lord went round (that garden during the night) whilst they were asleep,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:20: So, that (waving fruit-laden garden) became a harvested field in the morning.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:21: Then as the day dawned, they started calling out one another:
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:22: ‘Leave early for your tilth if you want to pick the fruit.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:23: So they set off whispering to one another:
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:24: ‘Do not let any pauper come near you in the garden today.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:25: And early in the morning they left, (feeling) quite competent to execute their plan (of getting the yield and depriving the poor of their share).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:26: Then when they saw that (ruined garden), they said: ‘We must have lost our way; (this is not our garden).’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:27: (But when they saw it cautiously, they cried: ‘Oh no!) We have been deprived indeed.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:28: One of them, wise and inclined to the balanced judgment, said: ‘Did I not say to you: Why do you not glorify and remember Allah?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:29: (Then) they said: ‘Our Lord is Holy. Surely, it is we who were the wrongdoers.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:30: So, blaming and maligning, they turned to one another.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:31: They said: ‘Woe to us! No doubt it is we who were disobedient and rebellious.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:32: We hope that our Lord may give us something better than this in exchange. Verily, we turn to our Lord.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:33: Such is the punishment. And truly, the torment of the Hereafter is far greater (than this). Would that they only knew!
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:34: Surely, for the Godfearing there are Gardens of Bliss with their Lord.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:35: Shall We (deprive) the obedient like the disobedient?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:36: What is the matter with you? How do you make a judgment?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:37: Do you have any Book with you in which you read (this),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:38: That it contains all that you like?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:39: Or have you any (such) firm covenants from Us as will subsist till the Day of Resurrection (by means of which We are bound) that you will be provided with whatever you shall decide (for yourselves)?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:40: Ask them which of them will vouch for such (a baseless assertion)!
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:41: Or do they have any partners (as well)? Then they should bring their partners if they are truthful.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:42: The Day when the ‘shin’ (i.e., the terrifying fierceness of the Hour of Rising) will be laid bare, and (the disobedient) people will be called to prostrate themselves, but they will not be able to do so (i.e., to prostrate themselves).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:43: Their eyes will be cast down (with terror and shame) and disgrace will be spreading over them, whereas they were called to prostrate themselves (in the world also) when they were healthy (but they, even then, refused to fall prostrate).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:44: So, (O Esteemed Beloved,) leave Me (to exact revenge) from the one who rejects this Revelation. Now We shall take them (towards disaster) so gradually that they will not perceive it.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:45: And I am giving them respite. Surely, My strategy is unbeatable.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:46: Do you ask them for any reward (for preaching the faith in Messengership) that they are weighed down with (the burden of) paying the recompense?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:47: Do they have the knowledge of the unseen that they write down (their judgments on the basis of that)?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:48: So be steadfast in waiting for the command of your Lord, and do not (take it to your heart) like (Yunus [Jonah], the Messenger with) fish episode, when he cried out (to Allah) in a state pent up with rage and grief (against his community).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:49: Had the mercy and blessing of his Lord not helped him, he would certainly have been thrown in the barren field, blamed. (But Allah saved him from that.)
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 68:50: Then his Lord exalted him and (placed him) amongst the perfectly pious (blessing him with His exceptional nearness).
